subject: Home & DIY
title: Biophilic Design Brings Nature Indoors
description: A quick, practical guide to Biophilic Design Brings Nature Indoors.

hook.text: Offices with plants and daylight see 15% higher productivity. Biophilic design taps our need for nature.

buildup.text: Biologist E.O. Wilson named our love of nature 'biophilia' in 1984. Architects now shape whole buildings around it.

discovery.text: Living walls, courtyards, and water features lower stress hormones and sharpen focus in measurable ways.

twist.text: Singapore's Changi Airport has a 40-meter waterfall inside the terminal, ringed by a forest. Nature is the design.

climax.text: Amazon's Seattle HQ houses 40,000 plants in glass spheres. Hospitals with biophilic design see faster recovery.

punchline.text: We build better when we build with nature.

quiz.question: What is biophilic design based on?
options: Our innate psychological need to connect with nature
A mathematical ratio found in natural growth patterns
